intro: Narcissus asturiensis var. villarvildensis, commonly known as the Villarvildensis daffodil, is a rare and endemic variety native to the Asturian region of northern Spain. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers with a white or greenish throat, typically blooming in early spring. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is valued for its ornamental beauty and botanical significance. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
